intro: Astrocaryum princeps var. aurantiacum, commonly known as the golden palm, is a species of palm native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, fan-shaped leaves that are often a vibrant green. The plant produces yellow-orange fruits that contain edible seeds, which are sometimes used in local cuisines. It thrives in humid, tropical climates with well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is also cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
